summary: John Dee Jay is an individual who appears to have been of counter-intelligence interest in 1972. He is described as attempting to solicit official information from members of the 66th USA Artillery Detachment in Soest, Federal Republic of Germany. He also inquired about former unit members and mentioned a 'package' for Cristobal Pimentel-Davilla. The documents suggest an investigation was launched into his activities by the 165th MI CO and the 66th MI Group.
significance: Based on the provided documents, John Dee Jay's significance to the JFK assassination context is not directly apparent. The documents relate to a possible counter-intelligence interest in 1972, which is several years after the assassination. Without further information, it is difficult to establish a direct connection.
